step_feedback.feedback: For step 1, try to keep your arms straighter overhead and your fingers more open. Your wrists were a bit far from the ideal position.
In step 2, focus on keeping your elbows closer to your body and your wrists more aligned with your arms. This will help engage your shoulder blades better.
For step 3, aim for a tighter fist and squeeze your shoulder blades together more. Your elbows and wrists were a bit off the target.
In step 4, try to extend your arms further back overhead and relax your muscles more. Your elbows and wrists were a bit far from the ideal position.
For step 5, focus on a smoother transition and keeping your wrists and elbows closer to the target. This will help with the pumping motion.

exercise_summary: You're doing a good job with the Push Down Pumping exercise! Remember to stretch your arms overhead with open fingers, then make a fist while squeezing your shoulder blades. Exhale as you relax and stretch back.
